keywords.term: Missouri, Saint Charles County, Salt River

div1.p: Bolin Whiteside being deposed says that in the year one thousand eight hundred and nine or thereabout be the deponent became acquainted with one James Rayen who there lived in the then County of Saint Claire Indiana Territory more now Madison County and that he Rayen left said Territory of Illinois in the year 1811 that when he came to the aforesaid County of St Clair and then Indiana Territory now Illinois Territory he had in his possession and deft in his possession all the time he lived in said Territory a yellow woman or Mullattoe woman named Anne and that he exercised authority over said Anne as a slave or indentured servant which is not definitely known to the deponent that when Ray on left said Territory he moved to Salt River in the then Louisiana Territory District of St Charles that this deponent has been informed that said Rayen has since died and that Henry Haight has administered on his estate that said Anne when known to this deponent was about the age of twenty years

Sworn to & subscribed
in open Court
Belleville 10 June 1818

W. Bolin Whiteside
affidavit of Anne Residence in Illinois
